query: Run a complete calibration workflow for Global lead demand: generate baseline forecast, check validation variance, run calibration if variance is high, and re-run forecast with calibrated parameters
expected_behavior: Step 1: Runs initial baseline forecast (forecast.py --region Global --scenario baseline)
Step 2: Generates QA report (qa_report.py) on the initial forecast output
Step 3: Identifies validation variance from QA report or output CSV columns
Step 4: If variance >50% for any segment, runs calibrate_coefficients.py with appropriate threshold
Step 5: Verifies that config.json was backed up before calibration
Step 6: Reviews calibration report showing which coefficients were adjusted
Step 7: Re-runs forecast.py with the calibrated parameters
Step 8: Compares initial vs calibrated variance to verify improvement
Demonstrates understanding of the feedback loop: forecast → validate → calibrate → re-forecast
Outputs show improved validation variance after calibration (lower percentage values)
Creates calibration report file documenting the adjustments made
